scenarios.name: Successful User Login, Company Selection, and Navigation to Tasks Page
scenarios.description: Verifies that a user can successfully log in with valid credentials, select their assigned company, and navigate to the 'Manage Tasks' page. This scenario covers the complete Phase 1 authentication and setup flow.
user_journey: Navigate to the application Base URL.
Enter a valid user email from the Excel data into the email input field.
Click the 'Continue' button.
Enter the corresponding valid password from the Excel data into the password input field.
Click the 'Login' button.
On the company selection page, locate and click the company name specified in the Excel data.
After the dashboard loads, click on the 'Action Items' menu item in the navigation.
From the submenu, click on the 'Tasks' option.
Wait for the 'Manage Tasks' page to load completely.
acceptance_criteria: User is successfully authenticated without any errors.
The correct company dashboard is loaded after selection.
The user successfully navigates to the 'Manage Tasks' page.
The 'New Task' button is visible on the 'Manage Tasks' page, confirming the page has loaded correctly.
test_data_requirements: Valid user credentials (Email, Password).
A valid Company_Name that the user has access to.

scenarios.name: Create a Core Task with Individual Team Member Assignment
scenarios.description: Verifies the creation of a task with a name, due date, and assignment to specific, pre-existing users via email search. This tests the core task creation and individual assignment functionality.
user_journey: Start on the 'Manage Tasks' page.
Click the 'New Task' button to open the task creation form.
Enter a task name in the 'Short Task Name' input field.
Click the date picker and enter a valid due date in MM/DD/YYYY format.
In the 'Search or Invite Team Members' input field, enter a pre-existing user's email address.
Wait for the autocomplete dropdown to populate.
Click the matching user from the dropdown options to select them.
Repeat the previous three steps for any additional emails.
Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the 'Save' button.
acceptance_criteria: The 'New Task' form opens successfully.
Task name and due date are populated correctly.
The specified, existing users are successfully found and selected from the dropdown.
The task is created successfully upon clicking 'Save'.
The application returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page after task creation.
test_data_requirements: A valid Task_Name.
A valid Due_Date in MM/DD/YYYY format.
A comma-separated string of one or more valid, pre-existing user emails for the 'Assigned_To' field.

scenarios.name: Create a Task with Bulk Assignment to 'All Users'
scenarios.description: Verifies that a task can be created and successfully assigned to all users in the system using the 'Assign to all Users' checkbox.
user_journey: Start on the 'Manage Tasks' page.
Click the 'New Task' button.
Enter a task name in the 'Short Task Name' input field.
Enter a valid due date in MM/DD/YYYY format.
Locate and click the 'Assign to all Users' checkbox to select it.
Scroll to the bottom of the form and click the 'Save' button.
acceptance_criteria: The 'Assign to all Users' checkbox is successfully selected.
The task is created successfully.
The application returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page.
test_data_requirements: A valid Task_Name.
A valid Due_Date.
The 'Assigned_To' field must contain the exact string 'Assign to all Users'.

scenarios.name: Create a Task with File Upload and Priority Alignment
scenarios.description: Verifies that a user can create a task, align it to a pre-existing Priority, and attach a document by uploading a file from their local system.
user_journey: Start on the 'Manage Tasks' page and click 'New Task'.
Enter a Task Name and Due Date.
Click the 'Start typing to search Priorities' input field and enter a pre-existing priority name.
Wait for the dropdown and select the matching priority.
Click the '+' icon next to the 'Documents' section.
In the document dialog, enter a Document Name and optional Document Description.
Ensure the document type is 'File'.
Locate the hidden file input, make it visible, and send the full file path to it.
Wait for the file to upload.
Click the 'Save' button in the document dialog.
Click the main 'Save' button to create the task.
acceptance_criteria: The pre-existing Priority is successfully found and selected.
The document upload dialog opens correctly.
The specified file is successfully uploaded and attached to the task.
The document dialog closes and the attachment is visible.
The task is created successfully with the alignment and attachment.
test_data_requirements: A valid Task_Name and Due_Date.
A valid, pre-existing Priority name for the 'Align_Priority' field.
A valid Document_Name.
Document_Type set to 'File'.
A valid Document_File name that exists at the specified 'File_Upload_Base_Path'.

scenarios.name: Create a Task with Link Attachment and Huddle Alignment
scenarios.description: Verifies that a user can create a task, align it to a pre-existing Huddle, and attach a document by providing a URL link.
user_journey: Start on the 'Manage Tasks' page and click 'New Task'.
Enter a Task Name and Due Date.
Click the 'Start typing to search Huddles' input field and enter a pre-existing huddle name.
Wait for the dropdown and select the matching huddle.
Click the '+' icon next to the 'Documents' section.
In the document dialog, enter a Document Name.
Click the document type dropdown and select the 'Link' option.
Enter a valid URL in the 'Enter Link...' field.
Click the 'Save' button in the document dialog.
Click the main 'Save' button to create the task.
acceptance_criteria: The pre-existing Huddle is successfully found and selected.
The document upload dialog opens correctly.
The document type is successfully changed to 'Link'.
The URL is accepted and the link is attached to the task.
The task is created successfully with the alignment and link attachment.
test_data_requirements: A valid Task_Name and Due_Date.
A valid, pre-existing Huddle name for the 'Align_Huddle' field.
A valid Document_Name.
Document_Type set to 'Link'.
A valid URL for the 'Document_URL' field.

scenarios.name: Create Multiple Tasks Sequentially in a Single Session
scenarios.description: Verifies the system's ability to process multiple task creation requests from a data source (e.g., Excel) within a single user session, without requiring re-login.
user_journey: Execute the full login and navigation flow for the first task in the data set.
Create the first task with its specified details (e.g., individual assignment).
Verify the application returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page.
Without logging out, proceed to the data for the second task.
Verify the 'New Task' button is still visible, confirming the session is active.
Click 'New Task' again.
Create the second task with its specified details (e.g., bulk assignment).
Verify the application again returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page.
acceptance_criteria: The user logs in only once at the beginning of the test run.
The first task is created successfully.
The user session remains active after the first task is created.
The second task is created successfully in the same session.
The system correctly returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page after each task creation.
test_data_requirements: A data source (e.g., Excel file) with at least two rows of complete and valid task data.
The first row must contain valid login credentials.
Subsequent rows should contain varied but valid task details.

dependencies: The test environment must be stable and accessible at the specified Base_URL.
Valid user credentials with appropriate permissions must be available.
All required test data (specific users, Priorities, Huddles) must pre-exist in the test environment's database.
For file upload tests, the specified file must exist at the configured 'File_Upload_Base_Path' on the test execution machine.
The user session timeout must be configured to be longer than the time it takes to execute all sequential tasks in the test run.
edge_cases: Creating a task with a due date set to the current day.
Creating a task where the Task Name, Priority Name, and Huddle Name use the maximum allowed character limit.
Successfully uploading a file of the maximum supported size.
Attaching a link that is a very long URL with many query parameters.
